unit.utterance: Na teitei roho, teo peho vuri a peha otei na teitei roho,
unit.utterance_translation: Once upon a time there lived a boy,

unit.utterance: evehe a sii otei bona a sii piipii.
unit.utterance_translation: this poor boy was covered with small sores.

unit.utterance: Evehe tea maamihu - maamihu nubunubu,
na nao nana ruene tea - tea sisibu.
unit.utterance_translation: (he) went to the river to - to bathe.

unit.utterance: Me be nao ruene tea sisibu, orepaa no goroho tea peha vasu.
unit.utterance_translation: And when (he) went to the river to bathe, he went (and) slept on a stone (after his bath).

unit.utterance: a vasu bona he na tei nana teo varirovana na ruene.
unit.utterance_translation: this stone was in the middle of the river.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
Me -
[PAUSE]
o peho - pakupaku tamuana vo tea -
teebona tea maamihu bon.
Maamihu bon toro gunaha nana ruene
unit.utterance_translation: Every day (he) had to go down to the river

unit.utterance: tea nubunubu,
orepaa no goroho nana tea vasu bona be varoroava nana.
unit.utterance_translation: then he went (and) slept on this stone when (he) was sun-bathing.

unit.utterance: A vasu bona me na tii vatotobin naona bono hum vai to -
unit.utterance_translation: This stone was also exactly lying in the place

unit.utterance: to nana maana a roava.
unit.utterance_translation: where the sun was (shining and) warming (it).

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
Merau peho
tea peha bon - bon,
mea peha bua otei paa kao gunaha nao roho ruene.
unit.utterance_translation: a couple of men went down to the river.

unit.utterance: A bua roosuu, a meha a - a ma- mata kehoo, a meha a ihu govaa.
unit.utterance_translation: Two giants, one - one had blind eyes, the other had his nose eaten away by sores.
unit.add_comments: <mataa kehoo> 'eye blind' and <ihu govaa> 'nose eaten away' are a possessive compounds that are classified as adjectival constructions (adj.constr). This sub-phrasal construction has the same syntactic properties as an adjective.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
Me - meori paa no tara bona sii otei bona evehe goroho nana tea vasu.
unit.utterance_translation: And they saw the poor boy sleeping on the stone.

unit.utterance: Meori - mea peha paa sue,
"Eh, eara kahi
nomaa vahaa eara paa ma dee a otei be peana goroho nanai."
unit.utterance_translation: come back (and) carry the boy away while (he) is sleeping here."

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
Me -
erau meori paa nao vahaa, a bua otei bari.
unit.utterance_translation: then they went back, these two men.

unit.utterance: Meha nubunubu meori paa kao gunaha bana vo maa ruene -
unit.utterance_translation: The other morning they went down again to the river -

unit.utterance: nubunubu meori paa kao gunaha bana maa ruene,
unit.utterance_translation: in the morning they went down again to the river,

unit.utterance: mea - a sii otei vai paa nao bana tea goroho tea vasu.
unit.utterance_translation: and this poor boy went again to sleep on the stone.

unit.utterance: Evehee a maamihu vuri vai to nomaa nae tea sisibu, amaa vahara beiko me na nomaa rori tea sisibu.
unit.utterance_translation: But every time he came to bathe, the (other) children also came to bathe.

unit.utterance: Me beori tara bea sahata vai goroho nana tea vasu,
unit.utterance_translation: And when they saw that this poor guy was sleeping on the stone,

unit.utterance: a piipii, a piipiiana,
unit.utterance_translation: covered with sores, full of sores,

unit.utterance: eve repaa -
eori repaa kao geve bari, ei kou
unit.utterance_translation: they would turn away from him, because

unit.utterance: sa rake bata haari tea sisibu
unit.utterance_translation: they did not want to bathe

unit.utterance: rihina bona otei vai, a piipii.
unit.utterance_translation: near this boy covered with sores.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
Me -
teo peho bon bana kou,
a bua roosuu vai kao gunaha vai bana maai.
unit.utterance_translation: these two giants went down again.

unit.utterance: Kao gunaha taneo bana maa teo hopo teori meori paa gunaha maa ruene.
unit.utterance_translation: Went down again from their cave and they went down to the river.

unit.utterance: Sun rori rau, eori tara bana nao bona sii otei vai goroho nana tea - tea vasu.
unit.utterance_translation: Standing there, they saw again this poor boy sleeping on the - on the stone.

unit.utterance: Meori paa paku bono peho vakokona teori,
"Eara kahi gono rara e ta naono,
[PAUSE]
eara kahi -
are paa nao, are paa kiskis a -
unit.utterance_translation: then we go, then we tie the -

unit.utterance: kis a moona -
unit.add_comments: In Teop the object <a moona otei vai ae kurinae> 'the feet of this boy and his hands' has the singular form.

unit.utterance: a otei vai ae kurinae, are paa dee eve."
unit.utterance_translation: this boy together and his hands, then we carry him (like a pig being carried on a pole)."

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
Merau,
meori paa paku vo teebona.
[PAUSE]
Nao vai,
kis bona a ku- a bua kurina -
unit.utterance_translation: tied the two hands of the

unit.utterance: a sahata vai, a piipii, a piipiiana,
unit.utterance_translation: the poor (boy), covered with sores, full of sores,

unit.utterance: meori paa nao, meori paa no kisi pete bona -
unit.utterance_translation: and they went, and they went (and) also tied

unit.utterance: a moonae,
meori paa hogo ni bari tea -
hogo guna- hogo ni nao bona ta naono teo -
tea kurinae ae tea moonae, meori paa dee bari.
unit.utterance_translation: through his (tied) hands and feet, and then they carried him.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
E Ihu- Ihugovaa to - to dee momohu batana.
unit.utterance_translation: Rottennose was carrying (him) in the front.

unit.utterance: E Matakehoo he na dee vamurina ba- batana, ei kou ei -
unit.utterance_translation: But Blindeye was carrying (him) in the back, because -

unit.utterance: e Ihugovaa na antee nana tea tara bona hanana to pita bata riori.
unit.utterance_translation: Rottennose could see the way they were walking along.

unit.utterance: Meori paa dee bona e Piipii,
e Piipiiana vai, meori dee, meori dee, meori dee
unit.utterance_translation: Piipiiana, and they carried and carried and carried,

unit.utterance: a sahata he na vakokona pahi batana to kahi paku -
unit.utterance_translation: while the poor guy was pondering what to do -

unit.utterance: toro paku vaavaha vuee.
Tei vai me bona vakokona vai ei -
kahi kurukurus nana - koto kurukurus nana bona -
kahi koto kurukurus nana bono kara taba vai kurinae.
unit.utterance_translation: (he) would bite off this string on his hands.

unit.utterance: Mepaa paku vo teebona,
koto kurukurus vai bono kara taba vaa -
[PAUSE]
kurinae,
erau vaahuka vai bona suinnae mepaa no -
unit.utterance_translation: then (he) moved his body forward and moved -

unit.utterance: mepaa no at-
rigarigaha bona - a moonae.
A bua otei he dee -
dee batari, na toku batari
bona taba to paku bata nae a otei vai,
unit.utterance_translation: what he was doing, this boy,

unit.utterance: e Piipiiana,
tea tabae e- a otei vai kou to dee vamurina batana a kehoo.
unit.utterance_translation: because this man who was carrying in the back was blind.

unit.utterance: Meori paa dee, dee, dee bari,
unit.utterance_translation: And they carried, carried, carried him,

unit.utterance: tara ahe vai bona -
o pea naono na hoa vo maana komana hanana.
unit.utterance_translation: a branch reaching over the track. (lit. inside the track)

unit.utterance: Dee oha batari bono pea naono bari,
unit.utterance_translation: (When they) were carrying him past the branch,

unit.utterance: evehee
[PAUSE]
iku teo naono -
iku vai teo naono,
[PAUSE]
mea bua otei paa dee kokoraa bono -
unit.utterance_translation: and the two men carried the -

unit.utterance: o naono o kokoraa.
A - e Piipiiana paa -
paa - paa kao - paa hana vaevuru.
Erau sue vai, "Erau,
erau rakaha aeae vai.
Eara na vahus batara vaan mepaa aeae."
unit.utterance_translation: We are coming close to the village, and (the pole) is light."

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
To - no toboha vaobete rori bona - e ta naono,
unit.utterance_translation: As soon as (they) put down the - the pole,
unit.add_comments: Both "bene ta naono" and "bona ta naono" are attested as object forms in the corpus, "bona ta naono" with 9 tokens, "bene ta naono" with 6 tokens; the unmarked forms "e ta naono" with 11 tokens and "a ta naono" with 3 tokens.

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
E - e Ihugovaa he tara vahiki bona otei, "Eh,
unit.utterance_translation: Rottennose saw that the boy was not there anymore, "Hey,

unit.utterance: havee to paa - ean sa paa haraa haa nom a otei he gunaha.
unit.utterance_translation: how - you did not notice that the boy went down.

unit.utterance: Gara vahaa, are nao vaha tea rake."
unit.utterance_translation: Come on, let's go again to search."

unit.utterance: Meori paa nao vaha maa meori
rake maa, rake maa, rake maa, rake maa,
tara hiava batari tea maa naono,
e -
e Ihugovaa tara ahe vaevuru nao bona -
unit.add_comments: In subject-to-object raising constructions the subject of the complement clause is marked by the object article. Formally it is like an object of the matrix clause, syntactically the subject of the complement clause.

unit.utterance: a otei vai he toka maana tea maa baneo,
unit.utterance_translation: this boy perching on the breadfruit tree,

unit.utterance: "Eh evei, e sii (?), ean toro gunaha koa maa,
unit.utterance_translation: "He is here, this boy, you must come down,

unit.utterance: kao gunaha vakahu maa.
Nomaa, ean kahi mate rakaha nom ei!"
unit.utterance_translation: Come, you will certainly die now!"

unit.utterance: [PAUSE]
A - e Ihugovaa tavus koa, peha vai
me peha, me peha, me peha, me peha.
unit.utterance_translation: and climbed and climbed and climbed.

unit.utterance: A otei na hio rakaha maana teo kopuru no naono.
unit.utterance_translation: The boy was sitting on the top of the tree.

unit.utterance: [SOUND OF A ROOSTER]
Me peha, me peha me vahus bata naona bone
unit.utterance_translation: And climbed and climbed and came close to

unit.utterance: e Piipiiana vai,
Piipiiana vai - e Piipiiana he -
[PAUSE]
beaka maa bona,
beaka maa me - meo - o - meo naono paa dohidohi.
unit.utterance_translation: shat and - and the tree became slippery.

unit.utterance: Me saka paa antee haa tea kao hiava,
me -
dohidohi, dohidohi, mepaa toboha
unit.utterance_translation: (it was) slippery, slippery, and as soon as

unit.utterance: peha hiava bata koana, evehe beaka maa bona matanae,
unit.utterance_translation: (Rottennose) climbed up, he (Piipiana) shat into his eyes,

unit.utterance: beaka pipi ni maa bona matanae.
Mea otei paa
dururiki gunaha maa me kao gunaha maa, mepaa viivap-
unit.utterance_translation: slid down and went down and -

unit.utterance: poro ni -
pusu no naono.
unit.utterance_translation: at the foot of the tree.

unit.utterance: E - e Matakehoo boha vai venei a ot-
unit.utterance_translation: Blindeye thought that this was the -

unit.utterance: a otei vai to paa kuu mau,
unit.utterance_translation: (that) it was the boy who had fallen down,

unit.utterance: mepaa gono bene ta naono me
pou bona, me pou, me pou, me pou,
unit.utterance_translation: hit him, and hit and hit and hit,

unit.utterance: me pou vamatemate bona -
pou vamatemate bone -
e vaabuakunae to pou komana vaha naei.
unit.utterance_translation: This was his companion whom he beat. [lit. His companion, whom he had beaten (was) this.]
unit.add_comments: 'this' translates "=i" DEM1 in the end of the clause, which syntactically is the subject. "vaabuakunae" 'his companion is <:dt> and syntactically the predicate.

unit.utterance: Eve na toku vo naenei e vaabuakunae
unit.utterance_translation: He did not know that it was his companion,

unit.utterance: na boha vo naenei a otei to paa gunaha e Piipiiana to paa kuu mau.
unit.utterance_translation: (he) thought that the man who had fallen down was Piipiiana who had fallen.

unit.utterance: Me Piipiiana to paa kao gunaha koa maa,
unit.utterance_translation: And Piipiiana who just came down

unit.utterance: gono bene ta naono mepaa
pou vamate bene -
e -
e Matakehoo.
Me e- a bua roosuu vai paa pate mateu.
unit.utterance_translation: And these two giants had died together.

unit.utterance: E Mata-- e Piip--
e Ihugovaa--
e Matakehoo paa asun vamateu.
Matak- Matakehoo he e Piipiiana to paa asun vamateu.
unit.utterance_translation: Blindeye on the other hand, (it was) Piipiiana who had killed (him).

unit.utterance: Mepaa kuhoo te kara tete.
unit.utterance_translation: And this is the end of the story.
unit.add_comments: The literal meaning of paa kuhoo te kara tete is unclear. None of the story tellers could explain it.
